description: '''Carla Venita Thomas''' (born December 21, 1942) is an American [[singing|singer]], who is often referred to as the Queen of [[Memphis soul|Memphis Soul]]. She is best known for her 1960s recordings for [[Atlantic Records|Atlantic]] and [[Stax Records|Stax]] including the hits "[[Gee Whiz (Look at His Eyes)]]" (1960), "[[B-A-B-Y]]" (1966) and "[[Tramp (Lowell Fulson song)|Tramp]]" (1967), a duet with [[Otis Redding]]. She is the daughter of [[Rufus Thomas]].
